definition: to be on the brink of/to be on the verge of

sentences.english: This almost-falling into chaos keeps life proliferating.
sentences.chinese: 这种几近坠落乃至混沌的运行状态确保了生命的增殖。

sentences.english: Many of the experiments involved pigs inflicted with near-fatal injuries.
sentences.chinese: 其中诸多实验包括在猪只身上施以几近致命的伤害。

sentences.english: Half suffocated he takes refuge in the park round the house.
sentences.chinese: 几近窒息，他开始求助于房外的公园。

sentences.english: A full-bodied wine with a deep red, almost black, colour.
sentences.chinese: 深红色几近黑色，酒体饱满。

sentences.english: Since then, the Japanese have been instrumental in nearly wiping out the Western grey whale population.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，日本人开始大肆捕鲸，西部灰鲸几近灭亡。

sentences.english: Among great powers, Russia is the only country where “old friends” hardly appeared.
sentences.chinese: 在大国中，俄罗斯是“老朋友”几近于无的国家。

sentences.english: Robert leaned back in his chair quiet and almost surly .
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特往椅背一靠，闷声不响，几近乖戾。

sentences.english: We come nearest to the great when we are great in humility。
sentences.chinese: 当我们极谦卑时，则几近于伟大。

sentences.english: After his three-year-old marriage broke up, he is almost on the ropes these days.
sentences.chinese: 当他结束了3年的婚姻后，这几天他几近崩贵。

sentences.english: He hopelessly approached the corner of the cottage and surprisingly found a water pump.
sentences.chinese: 他几近绝望地走到屋角，却意外地发现了一座抽水机。

sentences.english: A sudden major increase in corporate use of fax machines nearly put this small company out of business.
sentences.chinese: 公司使用传真机的突增使这家小公司几近倒闭。

sentences.english: Lennon, almost incidentally, had one of the best voices in rock.
sentences.chinese: 而列侬，几近是过于巧合，拥有一副唱摇滚的好嗓子。

sentences.english: Arem is a nearly extinct language of Vietnam and Laos.
sentences.chinese: Arem语是越南与老挝一种几近灭绝的语言。

sentences.english: We"ve priced it at $ 98, almost 30% less than the competition."
sentences.chinese: 我们订价为98美元，几近少于竞争敌手30%。

sentences.english: The official said the vice governors trekked into Yingxiu after many hardships and several close brushes with death.
sentences.chinese: 副州长徒步走了很多路，几近艰险才成功进入映秀乡。

sentences.english: Each time, the world was eager to see how nearly perfect she had become.
sentences.chinese: 每一次，整个世界都渴望一睹她几近完美的芳容。

definition: on the edge of/(fig.) on the verge of/close to
in the extreme (idiom)/incapable of further increase
to exhaust/to use up/to deplete/to drain
